channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What we know about the Gaza ceasefire deal
item.description: What we know so far about the possible ceasefire deal agreed between Israel and Hamas.

item.title: How Israel and Hamas agreed to a ceasefire in Gaza, hostage release deal

item.title: What the new inflation report means for mortgage rates
item.description: Inflation ticked back up during the last month of the year, which could have an impact on mortgage rates.

item.title: Georgian opposition leader beaten up, blames governing party members
item.description: Giorgia Gakharia needs hospital treatment in the latest attack on an opposition leader.

item.title: Firefighters report progress against LA blazes as winds pick up again
item.description: Millions of Southern Californians are nervously keeping watch as winds begin picking up during a final round of dangerous wildfire weather forecast fo...

item.title: John Deere faces U.S. lawsuit over farmers' ability to repair tractors
item.description: The Federal Trade Commission and two states accuse Deere of costing farmers time and money by unfairly limiting software access and forcing the use of...

item.title: Walgreens says locking up products from shoplifters hurt sales
item.description: Keeping products under lock and key dissuaded customers from purchasing them, Walgreens said in earnings call.

item.title: No more miners trapped underground in South Africa, volunteers say
item.description: At least 78 bodies and more than 200 survivors have been pulled out of a mine since Monday.

item.title: How do you ensure good luck on Lunar New Year? NPR wants to know
item.description: The Lunar New Year falls on Jan. 29 this year. NPR wants to know what traditions you uphold to ensure good luck in the year to come.

item.title: Firefighters need better weather to fight California’s flames. When will they get relief?
LA fires are still raging, but forecasters expect calmer winds in the coming days
item.description: It was another day of fierce winds gusting to 65 mph in mountainous areas of Los Angeles and Ventura counties, but weather more conducive to firefight...

item.title: Mozambique's new president sworn in despite opposition boycott
item.description: Daniel Chapo's legitimacy has been questioned following protests against his victory.

item.title: Gaza ceasefire deal to take effect on 19 January, Qatar says
item.description: The deal, which will also see hostages held in Gaza released, is expected to take effect on Sunday.

item.title: Biden reacts to the Israel-Hamas ceasefire, hostage release deal | Special Report

item.title: Ancient Celtic tribe had women at its social center
item.description: Ancient DNA reveals that during the Iron Age, women in ancient Celtic societies were at the center of their social networks — unlike previous eras of ...

item.title: As climate risks mount, U.S. homeowners face soaring insurance bills
item.description: Insurance companies are canceling homeowner policies across the U.S. — even in regions that aren't considered climate hot spots.

item.title: Inflation remains stubbornly high for many Americans. Could it get worse under Trump?
item.description: Consumer prices rose 2.9% in December from a year earlier, marking the third consecutive monthly uptick in annual inflation.

item.title: Relief, 21st-century style: As wildfires burn, GoFundMe becomes a repository of harrowing stories
